member.name: IFileSystemImage.CalculateDiscIdentifier
member.summary: Retrieves a string that identifies a disc and the sessions recorded on the disc.
member.param: String that contains a signature that identifies the disc and the sessions on it. This string is not guaranteed to be unique between discs.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
MultisessionInterfaces property must be set prior calling this method.
Value: 0xC0AAB15D

member.name: IFileSystemImage.ChooseImageDefaults
member.summary: Sets the default file system types and the image size based on the current media.
member.param: An the identifies the device that contains the current media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

Value specified for FreeMediaBlocks property is too small for estimated image size based on current data.
Value: 0xC0AAB121

The specified disc does not contain one of the supported file systems.
Value: 0xC0AAB151

member.name: IFileSystemImage.ChooseImageDefaultsForMediaType
member.summary: Sets the default file system types and the image size based on the specified media type.
member.param: Identifies the physical media type that will receive the burn image. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

Value specified for FreeMediaBlocks property is too small for estimated image size based on current data.
Value: 0xC0AAB121

member.name: IFileSystemImage.CreateDirectoryItem
member.summary: Create a directory item with the specified name.
member.param: String that contains the name of the directory item to create.
An interface of the new directory item. When done, call the IFsiDirectoryItem.Release method to release the interface.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IFileSystemImage.CreateFileItem
member.summary: Create a file item with the specified name.
member.param: String that contains the name of the file item to create.
An interface of the new file item. When done, call the IFsiFileItem.Release method to release the interface.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The provided name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IFileSystemImage.CreateResultImage
member.summary: Create the result object that contains the file system and file data.

param.name: resultStream
param.para: An interface of the image result.
Client applications can stream the image to media or other long-term storage devices, such as disk drives.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IFileSystemImage.Exists
member.summary: Checks for the existence of a given file or directory.
member.param: String that contains the fully qualified path of the directory or file to check.
Indicates if the item is a file, a directory, or does not exist. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

The specified path is not fully qualified. The path must begin with '\\' or '/' to indicate the image root, or the images position within a directory structure.
Value: 0xC0AAB110

The directory '%1!s!' not found in FileSystemImage hierarchy.
Value: 0xC0AAB11A

The object doesn't support this interface.
Value: 0x80004002

member.name: IFileSystemImage.GetDefaultFileSystemForImport
member.summary: Retrieves the file system to import by default.
member.param: One or more file system values. For possible values, see the enumeration type.
A single file system value that identifies the default file system. The value is one of the file systems specified in fileSystems

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_BootImageOptions
member.summary: Retrieves the boot image that you want to add to the file system image.
member.param: An interface of the boot image to add to the disc. Is NULL if a boot image has not been specified.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
A boot object can only be included in an initial disc image.
Value: 0xC0AAB149

The boot object could not be added to the image.
Value: 0xC0AAB148

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_ChangePoint
member.summary: Retrieves the change point identifier.
member.param: Change point identifier. The identifier is a count of the changes to the file system image since its inception.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_DirectoryCount
member.summary: Retrieves the number of directories in the file system image.
member.param: Number of directories in the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.summary: Retrieves the number of files in the file system image.
member.param: Number of files in the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.summary: Retrieves the list of file system types that a client can use to build a file system image.
member.param: One or more file system types that a client can use to build a file system image. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.summary: Retrieves the types of file systems to create when generating the result stream.
member.param: One or more file system types to create when generating the result stream. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_FreeMediaBlocks
member.summary: Retrieves the maximum number of blocks available for the image.
member.param: Number of blocks to use in creating the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_ImportedVolumeName
member.summary: Retrieves the volume name provided from an imported file system.
member.param: String that contains the volume name provided from an imported file system. Is NULL until a file system is imported.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_ISO9660InterchangeLevel
member.summary: Retrieves the ISO9660 compatibility level to use when creating the result image.
member.param: Identifies the interchange level of the ISO9660 file system.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_ISO9660InterchangeLevelsSupported
member.summary: Retrieves the supported ISO9660 compatibility levels.
member.param: List of supported ISO9660 compatibility levels. Each item in the list is a VARIANT that identifies one supported interchange level. The variant type is VT_UI4. The ulVal member of the variant contains the compatibility level.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_MultisessionInterfaces
member.summary: Retrieves the list of multi-session interfaces for the optical media.
member.param: List of multi-session interfaces for the optical media. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_Dispatch. Query the pdispVal member of the variant for the interface.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_Root
member.summary: Retrieves the root directory item.
member.param: An interface of the root directory item.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_SessionStartBlock
member.summary: Retrieves the starting block address for the recording session.
member.param: Starting block address for the recording session.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_StageFiles
member.summary: Indicates if the files being added to the file system image should be staged before the burn.
member.param: VARIANT_TRUE if the files being added to the file system image are required to be staged in one or more stage files before burning. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE is returned if IMAPI is permitted to optimize the image creation process by not staging the files being added to the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_StrictFileSystemCompliance
member.summary: Determines the compliance level for creating and developing the file-system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the file system images are created in strict compliance with applicable standards.
Is VARIANT_FALSE if the compliance standards are relaxed to be compatible with IMAPI version 1.0.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_UDFRevision
member.summary: Retrieves the UDF revision level of the imported file system image.
member.param: UDF revision level of the imported file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_UDFRevisionsSupported
member.summary: Retrieves a list of supported UDF revision levels.
member.param: List of supported UDF revision levels. Each element of the list is VARIANT. The variant type is VT_I4. The lVal member of the variant contains the revision level.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_UsedBlocks
member.summary: Retrieves the number of blocks in use.
member.param: Estimated number of blocks used in the file-system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.get_UseRestrictedCharacterSet
member.summary: Determines if the file and directory names use a restricted character.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the file and directory names to add to the file system image must consist of characters that map directly to CP_ANSI (code points 32 through 127). Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.summary: Retrieves the volume name for this file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.param: String that contains the path to the temporary directory.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.IdentifyFileSystemsOnDisc
member.summary: Retrieves a list of the different types of file systems on the optical media.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device that contains the media. If this parameter is NULL, the discRecorder specified in will be used.
One or more files systems on the disc. For possible values, see enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.ImportFileSystem
member.summary: Imports the default file system on the current disc.
member.param: Identifies the imported file system. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
MultisessionInterfaces property must be set prior calling this method.
Value: 0xC0AAB15D

The specified disc does not contain one of the supported file systems. Value: 0xC0AAB151
Note The file systems are likely supported for the operation, but at the low levels, IMAPI2 when calling ImportFileSystem, it has generic exception/error handling and reports back error 0xC0AAB151. If the disc is not acquired for exclusive access or otherwise access denied, this error won't be reported.

A boot object can only be included in an initial disc image.
Value: 0xC0AAB149

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

Value specified for FreeMediaBlocks property is too small for estimated image size based on current data.
Value: 0xC0AAB121

The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

IMAPI supports none of the multisession type(s) provided on the current media.
Value: 0xC0AAB15C
Note method returns this error if there is no media in the recording device.

Operation failed because of incompatible layout of the previous session imported from the medium.
Value: 0xC0AAB133

member.name: IFileSystemImage.ImportSpecificFileSystem
member.summary: Import a specific file system from disc.
member.param: Identifies the file system to import. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

MultisessionInterfaces property must be set prior calling this method.
Value: 0xC0AAB15D

A boot object can only be included in an initial disc image.
Value: 0xC0AAB149

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

IMAPI supports none of the multisession type(s) provided on the current media.
Value: 0xC0AAB15C
Note method returns this error if there is no media in the recording device.

Operation failed because of incompatible layout of the previous session imported from the medium.
Value: 0xC0AAB133

The specified disc does not contain a '%1!ls!' file system.
Value: 0xC0AAB152

The file system specified for import contains an invalid file name.
Value: 0xC0AAB110

member.name: IFileSystemImage.LockInChangePoint
member.summary: Locks the file system information at the current change-point level.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_BootImageOptions
member.summary: Sets the boot image that you want to add to the file-system image. This method creates a complete copy of the passed-in boot options by copying the stream from the supplied interface.
member.param: An interface of the boot image that you want to add to the file-system image. Can be NULL.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
A boot object can only be included in an initial disc image.
Value: 0xC0AAB149

The boot object could not be added to the image.
Value: 0xC0AAB148

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_FileSystemsToCreate
member.summary: Sets the file systems to create when generating the result stream.
member.param: One or more file systems to create when generating the result stream. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

This file system image has too many directories for the %1!ls! file system.
Value: 0xC0AAB130

You cannot change the file system specified for creation, because the file system in the imported session and the one in the new session do not match.
Value: 0xC0AAB163L

ISO9660 is limited to 8 levels of directories.
Value: 0xC0AAB131

You cannot change the file system specified for creation, because the file system from the imported session and the file system in the current session do not match.
Value: 0xC0AAB133

This feature is not supported for the current file system revision. The image will be created without this feature.
Value: 0x00AAB15FL

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_FreeMediaBlocks
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of blocks available for the image.

param.name: newVal
param.para: Number of blocks to use in creating the file system image.
By default, 332,800 blocks are used to create the file system image. This value assumes a capacity of 74 minutes of audio per 650MB disc.
To specify an infinite number of block, set newVal to zero.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
Value specified for FreeMediaBlocks property is too small for estimated image size based on current data.
Value: 0xC0AAB121

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_ISO9660InterchangeLevel
member.summary: Sets the ISO9660 compatibility level of the file system image.
member.param: ISO9660 compatibility level of the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_MultisessionInterfaces
member.summary: Sets the list of multi-session interfaces for the optical media.
member.param: List of multi-session interfaces for the optical media. Each element of the list is a VARIANT whose type is VT_DISPATCH. Query the multi-session interface for its IDispatch interface and set the pdispVal member of the variant to the IDispatch interface.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
IMAPI does not support the multisession type requested.
Value: 0xC0AAB15B

IMAPI does not allow multi-session with the current media type.
Value: 0xC0AAB159

IMAPI supports none of the multisession type(s) provided on the current media.
Value: 0xC0AAB15C

One of multisession parameters cannot be retrieved or has a wrong value.
Value: 0xC0AAB162

Cannot seek to block %1!I64d! on source disc. This value is also returned if the optical media is blank.
Value: 0xC0AAB156

returns.div: Note Values returned by the IUnknown.QueryInterface method may also be returned here.

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_SessionStartBlock
member.summary: Sets the starting block address for the recording session.
member.param: Block number of the new recording session.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_StageFiles
member.summary: Determines if the files being added to the file system image should be staged before the burn.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to force files added to the file system image to be staged in one or more stage files before burning. Otherwise, set to VARIANT_FALSE if staging is not required and higher performance is desired.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_StrictFileSystemCompliance
member.summary: Determines the compliance level for creating and developing the file-system image.

param.name: newVal
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to create the file system images in strict compliance with applicable standards. You can specify VARIANT_TRUE only when the file system image is empty.
Set to VARIANT_FALSE to relax the compliance standards to be compatible with IMAPI version 1.0.

member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_UDFRevision
member.summary: Sets the UDF revision level of the file system image.
member.param: A hexadecimal number representing the UDF revision level.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_UseRestrictedCharacterSet

summary.para:
Determines if file and directory names should be restricted to using only CP_ANSI characters.
Note IFileSystemImage.put_UseRestrictedCharacterSet has been deprecated. Implementing this method is not recommended.

member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to restrict file and directory names to use only CP_ANSI characters. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_VolumeName
member.summary: Sets the volume name for this file system image.
member.param: String that contains the volume name for this file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

member.name: IFileSystemImage.put_WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Sets the temporary directory in which stash files are built.
member.param: String that contains the path to the temporary working directory. The default is the current temp directory.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

The working directory %1!ls! is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB140

Cannot set working directory to %1!ls!. Space available is %2!I64d! bytes, approximately %3!I64d! bytes required.
Value: 0xC0AAB141

member.name: IFileSystemImage.RollbackToChangePoint
member.summary: Reverts the image back to the specified change point.
member.param: Change point that identifies the target state for rollback.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
This file system image has too many directories for the %1!ls! file system.
Value: 0xC0AAB130

ISO9660 is limited to 8 levels of directories.
Value: 0xC0AAB131

member.name: IFileSystemImage.SetMaxMediaBlocksFromDevice
member.summary: Set maximum number of blocks available based on the capabilities of the recorder.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device from which you want to set the maximum number of blocks available.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Use this interface to build a file system image, set session parameter, and import or export an image.
The file system directory hierarchy is built by adding directories and files to the root or child directories.
To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(MsftFileSystemImage) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IFileSystemImage) for the interface identifier.
